race.name: Rad Dirt Fest
race.tagline: Colorado Rockies adventure—100km of high-altitude gravel, 2,500m elevation, Salida scenery.

climate.description: September: 10-25°C, 30% rain chance, autumn conditions, high altitude.

terrain.surface: 80% gravel, 20% dirt roads. Colorado Rockies—high altitude (2,200-3,000 m), technical climbs. 2,500 m over 100 km. Monarch Pass area, Arkansas River Valley. Technical rating: 4/5.

biased_opinion.summary: Rad Dirt Fest is Colorado Rockies adventure—100 km, 2,500 m elevation. Founded ~2018. 80% gravel, 20% dirt. High altitude (2,200-3,000 m), technical climbs. 500-800 riders. Salida, CO (great town). September autumn conditions (10-25°C). Affordable entry ($150-$200). If you want Colorado Rockies high-altitude gravel with stunning scenery, this is it. If you need sea-level race, skip it. Altitude is the challenge.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: Rad Dirt Fest is Colorado Rockies high-altitude gravel. 100 km, 2,500 m, 2,200-3,000 m altitude. If you want Colorado Rockies scenery with technical climbs, this is it. If you need sea-level, skip it. Altitude is the challenge. Salida is great town. Affordable entry.

black_pill.title: HIGH ALTITUDE + 2,500M ELEVATION + TECHNICAL CLIMBS
black_pill.reality: High altitude (2,200-3,000 m) = thin air. Acclimatization required. 2,500 m elevation over 100 km. Technical climbs (steep Colorado Rockies). September = 30% rain risk. 15-20% DNF. You'll pay $150-$200 + travel. If you need sea-level, this isn't it. If you want Colorado Rockies high-altitude adventure, this is it. Altitude is the main challenge.
black_pill.expectation_reset: Rad Dirt Fest is Colorado Rockies high-altitude gravel. 2,200-3,000 m altitude, 2,500 m elevation. If you need sea-level, skip it. If you want Colorado Rockies scenery with technical climbs, this is it. Altitude is the challenge. Acclimatize.

logistics.travel_summary: Fly to Denver (DEN). Rental car needed (200 km, 2.5-hour drive to Salida). Salida lodging—book early. Multi-day expo. Race September.
logistics.food_options: Aid stations on course. Post-race party in Salida.

course_description.character: 100 km, 2,500 m. 80% gravel, 20% dirt. Colorado Rockies—high altitude (2,200-3,000 m), technical climbs. Technical rating: 4/5.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: High Altitude
suffering_zones.description: 2,200-3,000 m altitude. Thin air. Acclimatization required.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Arrive early. Acclimatize. Pace conservatively. Hydrate. Altitude is the main challenge.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Technical Climbs
suffering_zones.description: Steep Colorado Rockies climbs. 2,500 m cumulative elevation. Technical.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Low gears. Pace conservatively. Technical skills required. 38-42mm tires.

course_description.signature_challenge: 100 km + 2,500 m elevation + high altitude (2,200-3,000 m). Colorado Rockies.

history.origin_story: Rad Dirt Fest founded ~2018. Salida, CO. 100 km, 500-800 riders. Colorado Rockies. High altitude gravel.
history.reputation: Colorado gravel scene. Salida. High altitude. Technical climbs. Well-organized.
